sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A true copy of two speeches spoken by two orphans, educated in Christ-Hospital, on the 13th day of August, 1663 being a day set apart to commemorate God's mercies bestowed on their fellow-brethren, who were formerly educated and brought up in the said hospital. Parker, John. Brice, Thomas, fl. 1663.
[2], 11 p. 15 cm.
Printed by William Godbid, London, M. DC. LXIII [1663]
First speech signed: John Parker, orphan; second speech signed: Thomas Brice, orphan. Reproduction of original in: William Andrews Clark Memorial Library, University of California, Los Angeles.
=======
A true copy of two speeches spoken by two orphans, educated in Christ-Hospital, on the 13th day of August, 1663 being a day set apart to commemorate God's mercies bestowed on their fellow-brethren, who were formerly educated and brought up in the said hospital. Parker, John. Brice, Thomas, fl. 1663.
[2], 11 p. 15 cm.
Printed by William Godbid, London, M. DC. LXIII [1663]
First speech signed: John Parker, orphan; second speech signed: Thomas Brice, orphan. Reproduction of original in: William Andrews Clark Memorial Library, University of California, Los Angeles.
William Godbid
